aws::graph::propositions: # Amazon CityOS Smart City Initiative Announcement
Amazon announced CityOS on 2025-09-22.
CityOS is a smart city initiative.
CityOS will transform urban infrastructure.

CityOS integrates cloud computing services.
CityOS launches in partnership with 25 major cities worldwide.
Amazon plans to expand CityOS to 200 metropolitan areas.
The expansion will occur over the next five years.
CityOS represents a $20 billion investment in urban technology infrastructure.
CityOS addresses traffic congestion challenges.
CityOS addresses energy efficiency challenges.
CityOS addresses public safety challenges.
CityOS addresses environmental sustainability challenges.
CityOS deploys millions of interconnected sensors throughout participating cities.
The interconnected sensors create a comprehensive digital nervous system.
The digital nervous system monitors urban operations in real-time.
The digital nervous system optimizes urban operations in real-time.
Dr. Michael Torres is Amazon's Vice President of Smart City Solutions.
Dr. Michael Torres stated "Cities are the engines of human progress, but they're also facing unprecedented challenges."
Dr. Michael Torres stated "CityOS provides city leaders with the tools and insights they need to create more livable, sustainable, and efficient urban environments for their residents."

metadata.header_path: /Amazon Partners with Cities to Deploy Comprehensive Smart Infrastructure Platform/
/Amazon Partners with Cities to Deploy Comprehensive Smart Infrastructure Platform/

text:
## News Report

Amazon today announced CityOS, an ambitious smart city initiative that will transform urban infrastructure through the integration of Internet of Things sensors, artificial intelligence analytics, and cloud computing services. The platform launches in partnership with 25 major cities worldwide, with plans to expand to 200 metropolitan areas over the next five years.

CityOS represents a $20 billion investment in urban technology infrastructure that addresses critical challenges including traffic congestion, energy efficiency, public safety, and environmental sustainability. The platform deploys millions of interconnected sensors throughout participating cities, creating a comprehensive digital nervous system that monitors and optimizes urban operations in real-time.

"Cities are the engines of human progress, but they're also facing unprecedented challenges," said Dr. Michael Torres, Amazon's Vice President of Smart City Solutions. "CityOS provides city leaders with the tools and insights they need to create more livable, sustainable, and efficient urban environments for their residents."
